Posts.Content: LiveStrongMom311 wrote: Rash on breast, itchy and tender. SCO a punch biopsy measuring 0.2 x 02. cms Microscopic: Centrally the epidermis demonstrates one nest of melanocytes at the dermo-epidermal junction compatible with junctional nevus.  The subepidermal tissues demonstrate a superficial and deep perivascular and interstitial lymphocytic infiltrate mixed with some eosinophils. Diagnosis: Junctional nevus with superficial and deep perivascular mixed dermatitis. So my question is - I don't have a mole and according to Wikipedia junctional nevus is a mole!  It was a red rash.  It was a small one - then it started to go away, and then it came back much bigger and in a few little patches that are close to each other.  It's sort of itchy at times, but my boob still feels funny.  My Dr didnt give me any referall to a dermatologist and he didnt think I needed an appt to see him.  I just picked up these reports this morning.  This biopsy was done 3 weeks ago. Posts.Title: I dont understand my biopsy report - it says..... LiveStrongMom311 lago

Posts.Content: LiveStrongMom311 wrote: I have to wait two weeks for the results.  The Dr that told me 10 days ago it was shingles or dermatitis now said she doesn't think it was that, but now she thinks fungal infection.  I said PLEASE just to a biopsy - this rash has been here since Sept 24.  She said she felt a node in my arm pit (which has been tender).....she said it wasn't swollen, but just that she felt it.  So I am worried and waiting.  Oh, I had an ultra sound yesterday as well.  The tech that did it said she didn't see anything "alarming"......and she said "oh that looks like shingles".  I have stopped the Keflex b/c I don't think I have mastitis.  Anyway - I could use all the positive vibes I can get!
